#### If you're starting from scratch, begin at **Step 1.** If you already have an existing repository that you'd like to create a GitHub page for, skip to **Step ?.** 

### **Step 1:** Create a new repository on GitHub
```{r Step_01, echo = FALSE, fig.cap = "Do so by navigating to Repositories > New. Give your repo an informative name and a description, if you'd like. Initializing it with a README and a .gitignore is recommended.", out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("../media/gh_page_screenshots/01_setup_repo.png")
```

### **Step 2:** Clone your respository to your computer

#### **Step 2.1:** Copy your repository URL from GitHub
```{r Step_02.1, echo = FALSE, fig.cap = "Click on the green 'Code' button and copy the URL to your clipboard.", out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("../media/gh_page_screenshots/02.1_clone_repo.png")
```

#### **Step 2.2:** Create a new project in RStudio. 
```{r Step_02.2, echo = FALSE, fig.cap = "In RStudio, click on Project (top right hand corner) > New Project.", out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("../media/gh_page_screenshots/02.2_new_project.png")
```

#### **Step 2.3:** Select "Version Control." 
```{r Step_02.3, echo = FALSE, fig.cap = "", out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("../media/gh_page_screenshots/02.3_version_control.png")
```

#### **Step 2.4:** Select "Git." 
```{r Step_02.4, echo = FALSE, fig.cap = "", out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("../media/gh_page_screenshots/02.4_git.png")
```

#### **Step 2.5:** Paste the repo URL and press the 'Tab' button on your keyboard to auto-fill the Project Directory Name. Click 'Create Project.'
```{r Step_02.5, echo = FALSE, fig.cap = "Remember to choose where you would like to save your project by clicking on the 'Browse' button and picking a subdirectory. I like to save all my projects under a 'Repositories' subdirectory for the sake of organization.", out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("../media/gh_page_screenshots/02.5_clone_git_repo.png")
```
